metadata.title: CVE-2019-15692 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
TigerVNC version prior to 1.10.1 is vulnerable to heap buffer overflow.Vulnerability could be triggered from CopyRectDecoder due to incorrectvalue checks. Exploitation of this vulnerability could potentially resultinto remote code execution. This attack appear to be exploitable vianetwork connectivity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15692` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tigervnc-common - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
tigervnc-scraping-server - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
tigervnc-standalone-server - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
tigervnc-viewer - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
tigervnc-xorg-extension - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tigervnc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.1+dfsg-1').
